Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the judicial review application is moot due to a stay order halting removal
Crimes.Application_Facts: Applicants were subject to a removal order and had their deferral request denied; a court-issued stay order prevented their deportation
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of the denial of deferral and a stay of removal
Crimes.Court_Ruling: Justice Snider agreed with Justice Gibson that the application is moot due to the stay order
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Enforcement officer denied deferral of removal
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Denial of deferral request despite risk or hardship
Crimes.Legal_Standard: A case is moot if no live issue remains for adjudication
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Existence of a court-ordered stay preventing removal
Crimes.Applicable_Legislation: IRPA, sections related to removal and deferral
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Timing of stay order in relation to judicial review
Crimes.Review_Standard: Reasonableness or correctness, depending on issue characterization
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Not applicable – issue rendered academic by procedural development
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Court documents, removal order, stay order, application for deferral
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Cited: Section 72(1) of IRPA (judicial review), section 224 (enforcement provisions)
Crimes.Application_Basis: Request for deferral based on humanitarian or other grounds
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Stay order, removal order, judicial decisions
Crimes.Relief_Sought: Suspension of removal and judicial review of deferral denial
Crimes.Governing_Rule: A case becomes moot if the requested relief is no longer necessary or effective
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: None identified – dismissal not based on evidence but on mootness
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: Potential irreparable harm from removal, mitigated by stay
Crimes.Cause_Description: Applicants sought to prevent deportation after deferral was denied
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: Stay order treated as dispositive of the practical issue
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Violated: IRPA provisions on overstaying and compliance with conditions
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: No challenge to authenticity or admissibility
Crimes.Residency_Compliance: Failure to maintain legal status due to overstaying visa
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Issue: Federal Court jurisdiction over immigration matters
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Stay order rendered factual dispute academic
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: No live controversy remains due to stay preventing removal
Crimes.Legal_Standard_Applied: Mootness doctrine in administrative and immigration law

Crimes.Violation_Type: Failure to comply with removal order
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the judicial review application is moot due to a stay order halting removal
Crimes.Application_Facts: Applicants challenged enforcement officer’s decision denying deferral; removal stayed by court order
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of enforcement decision and stay of removal
Crimes.Court_Ruling: Justice Gibson's precedent applied; application dismissed due to lack of live issue
Crimes.Claimant_Status: Foreign national under enforceable removal order
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Enforcement officer refused to defer removal
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged unfairness or error in refusal to defer removal
Crimes.Legal_Standard: An issue becomes moot when it no longer requires resolution
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Granting of interim stay preventing actual removal
Crimes.Applicable_Legislation: IRPA, sections on removal enforcement and judicial review
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Effect of stay on justiciability of enforcement decision
Crimes.Review_Standard: Standard of review depends on nature of question: reasonableness or correctness
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Not reached – case dismissed on procedural grounds
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Removal order, stay order, judicial decisions, application records
Crimes.Application_Basis: Request for humanitarian or discretionary deferral of removal
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Stay order deemed determinative of practical consequences
Crimes.Relief_Sought: Suspension of removal and quashing of enforcement decision
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Litigation becomes moot when relief sought cannot affect parties' rights
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: None found – dismissal based on mootness, not evidentiary gaps
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: Risk of deportation pending review, mitigated by stay
Crimes.Cause_Description: Challenge to denial of deferral after removal order issued
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: Stay order accepted as valid and binding
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Violated: IRPA provisions governing compliance with removal orders
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: No disputes over evidence authenticity or relevance
Crimes.Legal_Provision: IRPA, Section 44(1) – obligation to leave Canada upon removal order
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Issue: Federal jurisdiction over immigration enforcement and review
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Stay order negates need to assess underlying enforcement decision
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: No practical impact from ruling given stay preventing removal
Crimes.Legal_Standard_Applied: Doctrine of mootness in administrative law context
